node.text:
Today, Revd Tim Hewes, 71, has sewn his lips shut outside News Corp offices in London to draw attention to the silencing of climate science by Rupert Murdoch and News corp, which has led to a catastrophic lack of effective action to tackle the climate crisis.

Speaking ahead of the action, Tim said:

‘I’m sewing up my lips to demonstrate the terrible and violent havoc Murdoch’s actions have reaped upon the world and to symbolically make visible this truth. Today there are countless people throughout the world who are voiceless and suffering because of the climate emergency. Climate science and truth has been muted and those who suffer are not being heard. I have tried everything other way I can think of to end the influences and madness represented by Rupert Murdoch and his denial of the climate emergency.’

Please pray for Tim.

#TellTheTruth

node.text:
On the day a seismic survey of the Kavango Basin has been approved, Ina-Maria Shikongo appeals to the presidents of Canada and USA to act in line with their own fine words about environmental protection and climate mitigation, and stop Recon Africa's oil exploration of the Kavango Basin.

As the Okavango Delta is protected for its precious biodiversity and fragile ecosytem, supporting over a million people, the only way Recon Africa could have got the go-ahead for drilling, is through corruption.  This makes the Canadian government complicit in the criminal destruction of an irreplaceable  African ecosystem.  We need some basic honest actions to align with all the apparent 'green' words of this Canadian government, and stop Recon Africa and all other pointless fossil fuel projects going ahead.

This seismic information is used to predict potential areas where oil or gas may be trapped in sufficient quantities for further exploration activities such as drilling of an exploration well.

node.title: CALLING OUT THE PRESIDENTS OF CANADA AND USA

node.text:
—

Recent satellite images reveal the scale of deforestation occuring in Bugoma forest reserve as Hoima Sugar company expands its land use deep inside the forest, and others encroach from outside. 

When Hoima Sugar was given premission to log and plant sugar cane in Hoima forest Forest, in 2016, the National Forestry Authority of Uganda took the matter to the High Court.  Yet, despite this forest being home to some of the world's most endangered species, including chimpanzees, and despite each hectare of land being worth $28,000 in carbon sequestration alone, the National Forestry Authority of Uganda lost the court case to protect this land. 

The satellite images reveal just how fast the decline is happening and  that we need to stand behind the earth defenders on the frontline protecting this forest.  The National Forestry Authority wardens are often subjected to violence and it is hard for local people to publicly support the forest for fear of reprisals. 

Around the world we stand united and strong. You have to act now! #climatecrisisishere
@xr_uganda #passthemic #climatejustice #bugomaforest

node.title: SAVE BUGOMA FOREST | PASS THE MIC

node.text:
PAS D’HUILE DANS LES VIRUNGA 

Repost from @350africa 

C’est notre travail de nous défendre et de démanteler l’économie des combustibles fossiles, tenir responsables ceux qui profitent de la cupidité des entreprises, et construire un monde qui met en avant une planète habitable et l’intérêt public. Découvrez @350Africa en partageant les histoires de militants courageux et de dirigeants locaux qui refusent de garder le silence.

NO OIL IN VIRUNGA 

Repost from @350africa 

It’s our job to fight back and dismantle the fossil fuel economy, hold accountable those who profit off corporate greed, and build a world that puts a livable planet and public interest first. Check out @350Africa as they share the stories of brave activists and local leaders who are refusing to remain silent. #NoOilinVirunga 

The launch of Fossil Free Virunga short film coincided with the Democratic Republic of Congo’s Independence Day and offered an opportunity to celebrate the brave activists and local leaders who are refusing to remain silent while one of the most biologically diverse areas on earth is plundered and destroyed. We continue to stand in solidarity with you!

Learn more about the Fossil Free Virunga short film and how you can take action to support the campaign: https://afrikavuka.org/virunga/ 

#africa #climatejustice #landback

node.text:
Repost from @amazonwatch @xr_uganda @forestrebellion 

A congressional commission in Brazil passed Bill 490 last week – threatening to reverse decades of Indigenous territorial demarcation and stop the process of demarcating Indigenous lands altogether. While peacefully protesting the bill, Indigenous peoples were shot with rubber bullets and teargassed. 

Indigenous Brazilians are calling on YOUR solidarity! How can you support them? 

1️⃣ Go to the link in our bio and sign the petition calling on U.S. Climate Envoy John Kerry (@climateczar) and the Biden Administration to speak out publically for Indigenous Brazilians and against this bill.

2️⃣ Follow @apiboficial to get informed and donate to their cause! Donate link in our bio. 

#MarcoTemporalNão #PL490Não #TerraIndigenaFica #Brazil #AmazonRainforest #IndigenousRights #Indigenous #HumanRights #ClimateJustice

node.title: STAND WITH BRAZIL’s INDIGENOUS PEOPLES - LINK IN BIO

node.text:
URGENT! Bolsonaro has placed allies of agribusiness in FUNAI (Indigenous Affairs Agency), and now the survival of uncontacted tribes is at risk.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Why? Because Emergency Land Protection Orders currently shielding the forests of three uncontacted tribes are due to expire this year – FUNAI MUST renew them to prevent catastrophic invasion of their territories.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
We need to let FUNAI know the world is watching – and ready to defend the rights of #UncontactedTribes.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
✊ Share using #AssinaFUNAI
✍️ Email: svlint.org/LPOemail (link in Survival's bio)

node.title: Uncontacted Tribes and Land Protection Orders - the hidden story

node.text:
The uncontacted Ãwa of the 'Papaya Forest' on Brazil's Bananal Island are surrounded by danger.

When their lands are stolen & invaded, uncontacted tribes fight for their survival - or whole peoples could be wiped out.

In this video, Kamutaja Ãwa, a relative of the uncontacted Ãwa, outlines the tragedy of disease & violence that followed forced contact with her family, and asks for the rights of her uncontacted relatives to be respected.

#UncontactedTribesWeek #TribalVoice #UncontactedTribes

node.title: "We cannot let the colonizers get rid of us"

node.text:
🎤PASS THE MIC🎤

Este sábado arrancamos la Rebelión Global #G7 enfrente de la embajada de Canada con un waltz! 💃🏻🕺🏻

En este waltz mostramos la situación de las mineras canadienses en México. Para visibilizar la hipocresía del gobierno de Canada, rumbo a la reunion de líderes del G7 que tendrá lugar en el Reino Unido del 11 al 13 de Junio.

🇲🇽 Un ejemplo importante del saqueo está en la minería: son las compañías mineras canadienses (en oro Goldcorp, Torex Gold, Equinox Gold, Alamos Gold, y Agnico Eagle Mines, y en plata estan Pan American Silver, y Fortuna Silver, entre otras), las cuales en los últimos 15 años han acaparado del 65% al 75% de la inversión extranjera en la minería. De las 10 minas de oro mas grandes de México, 6 son de mineras canadienses. México es por mucho el país con más extracción de plata en el mundo, y uno de los mayores en otros metales como el oro, cobre.

💰Y solo le pagan al gobierno mexicano menos del 1% en impuestos! Goldcorp (con sede en Vancouver), en Sonora pagó 0.04% en impuestos, 3000 veces menos que en Canada. Lo que NO es suficiente para cubrir el daño al medio ambiente, asi como la explotación humana y de recursos naturales. De las mas de 25 mil concesiones mineras en México, solo se hacen 200 visitas al año por parte de las autoridades.

😤Mas de 40 pueblos originarios han sufrido ocupación minera, y cuando protestan los asesinan. A los trabajadores mineros se les paga 8 veces menos que a los canadienses, y la mitad no tienen seguro medico.

💦La minería en México usa 400 millones de metros cúbicos de agua, y en muchos casos en zonas con estrés hídrico ya existente. Aparte de que son contaminados con metales pesados.

Este waltz de la muerte a dejado a las empresas canadienses ricas y al medio ambiente mexicano destruido.

#G7 #SuCodiciaNuestraMuerte #YourGreedourDeath
.
#LxsEstamosMirando #Wearewatchingyou #ProtejanNuestrxsDefensoresDeLaTierra #Protectourearthdefenders #HonrenSusDeudasMedioambientales #Honoryourenvironmentaldebts
#DejenDeMatarnos #StopKillingus

Fuentes:
https://www.proceso.com.mx/reportajes/2013/12/19/mineras-canadienses-ejemplares-en-su-pais-corruptas-en-mexico-127151.html
https://www.sinembargo.m

🎤 Pass The Mic: Global Rebellion 🎤

¡¡Hoy en el Día del Medio Ambiente arrancamos la Rebelión Global #G7 con el Sonidero Rebelde!! 💃🏻🕺🏻

@xr_youth_mx, @xrchihuahua, @xr_toluca, @xr_mex,  y  @xr_pachuca estamos bailando, pero también estamos recordando la avaricia e hipocresía de los gobiernos y empresas de los países del G7, que lo que no pueden destruir en sus países vienen a destruir a los nuestros, quieren comprar y vender todo, como si la vida tuviese precio.

🗓La reunión de líderes del G7 tendrá lugar en el Reino Unido del 11 al 13 de Junio

😤 Estos países suelen celebrar que en 2015 firmaron el histórico Acuerdo Climático de París para limitar las emisiones globales. Pero la realidad es que ninguna de las naciones del G7 está cumpliendo las promesas que hicieron. 🌎⌛️

💰 Mientras tanto sus empresas vienen a México con promesas de generar prosperidad en el país a través de sus inversiones. Pero la realidad es que están saqueando nuestros recursos, y dejandonos un territorio esteril y contaminado. 

⛏Un ejemplo importante del saqueo y contaminación son las mineras canadienses. 

⛽️Dada la crisis climática, es urgente hacer cambios profundos en nuestra sociedad, economía y gobierno. Ya NO podemos seguir extrayendo petróleo!! Pero las empresas petroleras del G7, siguen impunes destruyendo el planeta. En México tenemos empresas de Estados Unidos, Italia, Reino Unido, Alemania, y Francia. Todas ellas acercándonos cada vez más al punto de no retorno y colapso ambiental. 🌎⌛️

🚗 La gran industria automotriz en México (No. 6 global en 2018) también es muy contaminante, no solo en producción sino también en el uso de los automóviles mismos.  Aquí también empresas del G7 sobresalen, por ejemplo de Alemania, Japón,  Estados Unidos. No podemos seguir produciendo automóviles, y menos de combustión interna. 

Los países del G7 NO están haciendo lo suficiente para limitar el calentamiento global. Por eso les decimos que #LxsEstamosMirando, necesitamos que #HonrenSusDeudasMedioambientales, #ProtejanNuestrxsDefensoresDeLaTierra, porque sus empresas nos están matando y por eso les decimos #DejenDeMatarnos, #SuCodiciaNuestraMuerte.

node.text:
🎤 Pass The Mic: G7 Global Rebellion 🎤

“Les pays du #G7 doivent arrêter de se réjouir avec le bénéfice de leurs usines tant que leurs usines produisent des dégâts environnementaux au niveau mondial et qui nous affectent actuellement aussi dans notre région. Actuellement ici à shasha, nous sommes affectés par des inondations chose qui n’existait pas il y a plus de 15ans. Ces inondations se sont accélérées ces dernières années, depuis 2010 et occasionnent la perte et la destruction de nos maisons, nos écoles et quelques fois ces inondations rendent impraticable la route. Nous appelons donc les pays G7 à prendre conscience face à cette situation, et à agir en faveur du climat pour donner la chance à ce monde de survivre. Ces inondations occasionnent des maladies comme la malaria parce que les milieux marécageux formés suite à ces dégâts sont devenus des poches de résistance des moustiques. Actuellement dans notre région, suite au changement climatique, les agriculteurs ne savent pas encore comment s'adapter à leurs saisons culturales, parce qu’ils avaient comme seul repère de début de la saison pluvieuse où La saison sèche. Suite à la perturbation des saisons par le changement climatique, ils ont perdu ce repère et beaucoup cultuve soit dans des périodes pluvieuses ou sèches. la production de la région  est sensiblement affectée suite à cette perturbation. Comme le principal activité ici à shasha et ses environs est l’agriculture, la communauté locale s’appauvrit d'avantage. XR  Shasha appelle donc ces pays à honorer leur dette en faveur du climat, pour freiner cette allure dévastatrice de l’environnement.”
- XR Shasha, Democratic Republic of Congo 
@xrshasha 

#PassTheMic #G7 #COP #COP26 #XRShasha #DRC #DemocraticRepublicOfCongo #NousDevonsAgirMaintenant

node.text:
‼️IPCC REPORT: CODE RED ‼️

Climate change does not affect us equally but no more can even those in the Global North sit back watching from a plush chair. It is devastating lives and wrecking havoc with every passing day. Nowhere is safe. The time to act is now, and treat this crisis as the alarming emergency it is. 

“​​It is unequivocal.”

Those three words are the first in the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change’s new report - their starkest warning yet on global heating.

It has laid out how the climate crisis is unequivocally caused by human activities and is unequivocally affecting every corner of the planet’s land, air and sea already.

The report, produced by hundreds of the world’s top scientists and signed off by all the world’s governments, says within the next two decades temperatures are likely to rise by more than 1.5C above pre-industrial levels bringing widespread devastation and extreme weather.

The collapse of major Atlantic currents, ice caps, or the Amazon rainforest “cannot be ruled out”, the report warns.

António Guterres, the UN secretary-general, warned: “[This report] is a code red for humanity. The alarm bells are deafening, and the evidence is irrefutable: greenhouse gas emissions from fossil fuel burning and deforestation are choking our planet and putting billions of people at immediate risk.”

But the report is clear that there are no cliff-edges to the climate crisis. Each tonne of carbon pumped out increases the impacts and risks of extreme heat, floods and droughts and so every tonne of carbon matters. It will never be too late to act, the report shows. Instead, the real question is how bad will it get?

Source: @guardian 

#climate #climatecrisis #globalheating #environment #ipcc #climatechange #extremeweather #heat #nature #globalwarming #sustainability #climateemergency #unitednations #antonioguterres #worldnews #news

node.text:
ALL ROADS MUST LEAD TO REPARATIONS⁣
⁣
On Sunday rebels from across the UK came together with many movements in support of the Afrikan Emancipation Day Reparations Rebellion Groundings to block Brixton Road. It took place on Afrikan Emancipation Day, commemorated in the Caribbean and some parts of Africa marking the passing of the 1833 Abolition of Slavery Act.⁣
⁣
The Reparations Rebellion adopts a broad definition of reparations beyond monetary compensation, towards a focus on repair and stopping the harm. To this end, the roadblock reduced air pollution in Brixton and provided a space, to come together as community, including creating a Global Citizens Garden. People from all walks of life came together to prefigure what Planet Repairs and reparatory justice means for our communities. The day practically envisioned the future world devoid of ecocide which we demand. ⁣
⁣
#StopTheHarm #ActNow #ExtinctionRebellion ⁣
⁣
On 23rd August XR will take to the streets of London again⁣
⁣
This is the weekend of the 230th anniversary of the start of the Haitian Revolution in 1791 which has been declared the United Nations International Day for the Remembrance of the Slave Trade & Its Abolition. And will be marked as part of the rebellion.⁣
⁣
Link in bio to get involved ⁣
⁣
#RebelForLife #ImagineTheImpossible #CivilDisobedience #Nonviolent #EcologicalEmergency #RightToProtest #Ecocide #StopTheMaangamizi #Solidarity #TellTheTruth #ClimateJustice #Corruption #ClimateJustice #SystemChange not #ClimateChange

node.text:
XR BLOG: COULD REWILDING SAVE US? 

A lot has changed in Yellowstone Park in the past twenty-five years. Healthy stands of willow trees line the banks of streams. Songbirds sing from tree branches. Beaver dams made of willow dot the streams. If you’re lucky, you can spot a beaver slapping its tail on the surface of the water. Twenty-five years ago, it would’ve been difficult to find any of these species. What changed? And what made this healthy ecosystem possible? In one word: wolves. 

Read more on this in our blog article - link in bio. 

#ExtinctionRebellion #ExtinctionRebellionBlog #XR #XRBlog #ClimateCrisis #EcologicalCrisis #ClimateSolutions #EcologicalSolutions #Blog

UNBORN UPRISING 

Six pregnant women bared their bumps at Piccadilly Circus, demanding an end to fossil fuels and a future for their unborn children

“I am 9 months pregnant. I can't sit and do nothing - I am accountable as a parent and a citizen - and so I am here demanding that the Government use their power to end fossil fuels. We need to remember that our children will live in the world we leave behind.” Lily

In a climate emergency it is unthinkable to do anything but stop fossil fuels. It's too late not to act now

#ClimateEmergency #ActNow #StopTheHarm  

Join The Impossible Rebellion to demand the Government stop the harm and end fossil fuels now 23.08.21- Link in bio

If you're pregnant or a parent join @extinction.rebellion.families now

TURKEY IS ABLAZE RIGHT NOW. 

DONATE NOW. LINK IN BIO. 

“The apocalypse I’ve been bracing myself for seems to be right on our doorstep. After historic flooding across Germany, record heatwaves and droughts, now massive wildfires are sweeping across Turkey (sparked intentionally or by negligence, but able to spread because of high temperatures and wind). This is like watching a car crash in slow motion. Maybe instead of jetting off to space billionaires could try salvage this planet. Wake up world, we’re in a climate emergency.”

“All my love to anyone living through this, for those wanting to support Turkey I’ll share links to stories.”

Reposted from @aliceaedy 

Even though the cause of the wildfire has not been identified and/or linked to arsonists its important to note and remember that:

‼️Climate change has inexorably stacked the deck in favor of bigger and more intense fires.‼️

Photos from the Turkey wildfires by @mishka_bochkaryov @greenpeace @khaledbeydoun

node.text:
Today, Revd Tim Hewes, 71, has sewn his lips shut outside News Corp offices in London to draw attention to the silencing of climate science by Rupert Murdoch and News corp, which has led to a catastrophic lack of effective action to tackle the climate crisis.

Speaking ahead of the action, Tim said:

‘I’m sewing up my lips to demonstrate the terrible and violent havoc Murdoch’s actions have reaped upon the world and to symbolically make visible this truth. Today there are countless people throughout the world who are voiceless and suffering because of the climate emergency. Climate science and truth has been muted and those who suffer are not being heard. I have tried everything other way I can think of to end the influences and madness represented by Rupert Murdoch and his denial of the climate emergency.’

Please pray for Tim.

#TellTheTruth

node.text:
NO MORE FOSSIL GAS 

Extinction Rebellion Cape Town calls for a halt to all oil and gas drilling. Authorisation of new oil and gas activities runs contrary to South Africa’s climate change commitments, including its commitment to the Paris Climate Agreement.

Natural gas is not a clean form of energy. The drilling and extraction of natural gas from wells and its transportation in pipelines results in the leakage of methane which is a very, very powerful greenhouse gas.

Repost @extinctionrebellionsa

node.text:
NEWS FROM INDONESIA - UPDATED

30 million hectares are to be returned to indigenous governance. Deforestation has dropped 75%.

But what is the true picture? 

The Widodo administration have managed to pass bills that kills environmental protection, increase support for extractive industries especially coal, removes the space for civilians to contest corporation for operational license and allows criminalisation of communities that blocks any corporation activities in conflict land. We have also seen sharp increase of land grabbing incidences, criminalisation of indigenous communities and our only anti corruption eradication body have effectively been killed. 

Even though we have policies officially in place for land grants, giving land back to indigenous control, the progress is extremely slow and the policy for moratorium palm oil is done without any enforcement, along with additional conflicting laws that makes it possible to still destroy forests. Also they have started a new program called Food Estate which is legally allowed to even use the space of protected forest to turn into monoculture fields of industrial farming, which already has been proven to fail, but they're still going ahead using military power to make. Worth mentioning that 16 out of 30 of Widodo's cabinet ministers are mining industry players and 55% of the current house parliament seats are business owners. We are at our lowest point for environmental protection as well as democracy.😢 

And although the deforestation rate has decreased as a whole country, it is partially due to the forest area already dwindling from the previously deforested islands. But they have now started moving to the east where deforestation has increased in Papua instead. In today's world, we need deforestation to be negative, which is very possible because we have 14 million hectares of degraded land ready to be rehabilitated using funds from Norway but yet to be used because corporations still love to take logs to sell in the international market. 

There is still so much work to do. Support the work of @extinctionrebellion.id 

UPDATED - information @extinctionrebellion.id
